name: DNS and name resolution checklist
description: DNS is a frequent source of deployment failure in APIM projects. Use this checklist to prevent avoidable delays.
checklist: Identify all gateway hostnames and required custom domains.
Identify all backend hostnames APIM must reach (including internal/private names).
Decide where DNS zones live (public DNS, private DNS) and who owns changes.
Define how name resolution works from the APIM gateway path to private backends.
Validate name resolution from representative networks before cutover.
Document rollback steps for DNS changes during cutover.
validation: Resolve gateway and backend hostnames from the same network locations your clients and gateways use.
Confirm certificate matches hostname (SAN) for every TLS endpoint.
Confirm no split-brain DNS conflicts between public and private records.
pitfalls: Custom domain certificates not covering all required hostnames.
Private DNS changes not aligned with routing changes.
Cutover windows consumed by DNS propagation and cache issues.
nextSteps: Finalize the connectivity model and confirm it aligns with SKU capabilities.
Run the guided flow and ensure networking answers match your design.
